sen.j: 辺鄙な田舎であることを表すのに「酒屋へ三里 豆腐屋へ二里」という俚諺もある。
sen.e: In expressing the remote countryside, there was a vulgar proverb of "three ri (old Japanese unit of distance, approx. 3.927 km or 2.44 miles per ri) to a liquor shop, and two ri to a tofu shop."

sen.e: In describe the remote countryside, there was the vulgar proverb, "Three ri (the old Japanese unit of distance, approximately 3.927 km or 2.44 miles per ri) to a liquor shop, and two ri to a tofu shop."

sen.j: また、味噌などと同様に、各集落で共同で作られることもしばしばあった。
sen.e: As in the case of miso (bean paste), tofu was made communally in each village.
As was the case with miso (bean paste), tofu was made communally in each village.

sen.j: まず原料の大豆を、一夜（12時間ほど）真水に漬けておく。
sen.e: At first, soybeans as raw materials are soaked in fresh water overnight (for about twelve hours).
First, soybeans as raw materials are soaked in fresh water overnight (approximately 12 hours).
First, soybeans as raw materials are soaked in fresh water overnight (approximately 12 hours).

sen.j: 翌朝、十分に漬けあがった大豆を適度に水を加えながら石臼でクリーム状に磨り潰す。
sen.e: Fully soaked soybeans are mashed and creamed with a stone mill over adding a moderate amount of water in the next morning.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The next morning, the fully soaked soybeans are then mashed and creamed in a stone mill together with a moderate amount of water.
The next morning, the fully soaked soybeans are then mashed and creamed in a stone mill together with a moderate amount of water.

sen.j: このクリーム状に磨り潰された大豆のことを「呉」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Mashed soybeans are called "Go."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「呉」→"Go"[用語サイトでは、「呉」を"go" (mashed soybeas) と表記しておりますが、この場合、mashed soybeansが重複するので、"Go"と表記を変更しました。これに合わせ、以下 呉 を Go と表記しました。]
sen.e: The mashed soybeans are called "go."
The mashed soybeans are called 'go.'

sen.j: 次に呉をお釜に移し、適度に水を加えて濃度を調整し薪にて炊き上げる。
sen.e: After that, Go is put into an iron pot, a moderate amount of water is added to adjust a concentration, and Go is boiled with firewood.
The go is then placed in an iron pot, a moderate amount of water is added to adjust the concentration, and the go is boiled over firewood.
The go is then placed in an iron pot, a moderate amount of water is added to adjust the concentration, and the go is boiled over firewood.

sen.j: この時、呉はサポニンの作用で激しく泡立つため、消泡剤として食用油に石灰を加えたものを適度に振りかける。
sen.e: At this time, it is necessary to add a moderate amount of antifoaming agent which is obtained by adding lime to cooking oil because Go foams intensely by the action of saponin.
At this time, it's necessary to add a moderate amount of antifoaming agent, which is obtained by adding lime to cooking oil, because the go foams actively due to saponin.
At this time, it's necessary to add a moderate amount of antifoaming agent, which is obtained by adding lime to cooking oil, because the go foams actively due to saponin.

sen.j: 十分に炊き上がった呉を、布で濾して豆乳を木桶に取る。
sen.e: Go fully boiled is filtered with a cloth, and soy milk is put in a wooden pail.
The go, once it has fully boiled, is filtered with a cloth, and the resultant soy milk is poured into a wooden pail.
The go, once it has fully boiled, is filtered with a cloth, and the resultant soy milk is poured into a wooden pail.

sen.j: この豆乳が冷えないうちに凝固剤としてにがりを適度に加え、櫂と呼ばれる木の板で撹拌する（にがりを打った以降の一連の作業を寄せと呼び、職人の技の見せ所である）。
sen.e: A moderate amount of bittern as a coagulant is added to this soy milk while it is warm, and it is stirred with a wooden board called kai (paddle) (a series of work after adding bittern is called yose, and is a high point where a workman shows his technique).

A moderate amount of bittern is added to the warm soy milk as a coagulant, and it's stirred with a wooden board called a kai (paddle) (the series of task after the addition of bittern is called "yose," and it's a high point where the workman shows his technique).

A moderate amount of bittern is added to the warm soy milk as a coagulant, and it's stirred with a wooden board called a kai (paddle) (the series of task after the addition of bittern is called "yose," and it's a high point where the workman shows his technique).

sen.j: 豆乳の濃度、温度、にがりの量、そして適度な「寄せ」がそろうと、豆乳は水と分離することなく固まり始め、やがておぼろ状、またはプリン状の豆腐となる。
sen.e: When the concentration and temperature of soy milk, amount of bittern, and moderate degree of "yose" harmonize, the soy milk starts curdling without being separated from water, and is transformed into half curdled or pudding-like tofu before long.

When the concentration and temperature of the soy milk, the amount of bittern and a moderate degree of "yose" harmonize, the soy milk starts curdling without separation from the water, whereupon it soon transforms into half-curdled or pudding-like tofu.

sen.j: これを崩しながら内側に布を敷いた型の中に盛り込み、蓋をして重石を掛け、硬く水を切ると豆腐（木綿豆腐）となる。
sen.e: After putting this half curdled or pudding-like tofu into a mold lined with a cloth while being broken down, putting a lid on the mold, putting a stone weight on the lid, and draining it firmly, momendofu (firm tofu) is made.

After the half-curdled or pudding-like tofu is placed into a mold lined with a cloth so that it will break down, a lid is set on the mold, a stone weight is placed on the lid and the tofu is drained, thus producing momendofu (firm tofu).

After the half-curdled or pudding-like tofu is placed into a mold lined with a cloth so that it will break down, a lid is set on the mold, a stone weight is placed on the lid and the tofu is drained, thus producing momendofu (firm tofu).

sen.e: Stone mill

sen.j: 石臼で磨り潰されることにより、必要な蛋白分や糖分のみが液中に飛び出し、渋みの多い皮の部分はあまり細かくなることなく、おからとして排出されやすくなると言われている。
sen.e: It is said that when soybeans are mashed with a stone mill, only necessary protein and sugar come out in the liquid, and it becomes easy to extract astringent skins as okara without breaking up.

It is said that when soybeans are mashed with a stone mill, only the essential protein and sugar come out in the liquid, and it becomes easy to extract the astringent soybean skins as okara without allowing them to break up.

It is said that when soybeans are mashed with a stone mill, only the essential protein and sugar come out in the liquid, and it becomes easy to extract the astringent soybean skins as okara without allowing them to break up.

sen.j: 工業化された製法では、グラインダーで豆を微細に削る。
sen.e: In the industrial process of making, soybeans are ground finely with a grinder.
In the industrial production process, soybeans are ground finely with a grinder.

sen.j: 石臼を使うと、呉の焼け（酸化）が少なくなるとも言われている。
sen.e: It is said that the use of stone mill lessens yake (oxidation) of Go.

sen.j: 直火で炊き上げるため、呉が非常に焦げ付きやすい。
sen.e: Because it is boiled over direct heat, Go gets burned very easily.

sen.j: そのため、濃く粘度の高い呉を使って、現在のような高濃度の豆乳を作ることは、事実上不可能であった。

sen.j: 大豆固形分濃度は推定7〜8%であったと考えられる。
sen.e: The concentration of solid soybean was considered to be approx. 7 to 8%.

sen.j: 現在は蒸気釜で炊き上げるため焦げることはなく、豆腐の場合10〜13%の豆乳が一般的である。
sen.e: In the case of present-day tofu, the general concentration of soy milk is 10 to 13% because Go does not get burned due to boiling with a steam boiler.
In the case of present-day tofu, the general concentration of soy milk is ten to thirteen percent because go won't scorch when it's heated with a steam boiler.

sen.j: 呉を炊くと、大豆中のサポニンが激しく泡立つため、お釜から呉が容易に吹きこぼれてしまう。
sen.e: Since the saponin contained in soybeans foam intensely when Go is boiled, Go boils over the pot easily.
Because the saponin contained in soybeans foams intensively when go is boiled, the go will easily boil over.

sen.j: また泡立った呉から取った豆乳もホイップ状の泡に包まれてしまうので、まともににがりを打ち、寄せの作業をすることが出来ない。
sen.e: In addition, since soy milk extracted from foamed Go is covered with foam in the whipped form, it is impossible to add bittern and do work of yose properly.
Additionally, since the soy milk extracted from the foamed go is covered with foam in a whipped state, it's impossible to add bittern and properly do the work of yose.

sen.j: このため古くから豆腐製造業者においては、前記の消泡剤を使うのが一般的であった（『豆腐集説』明治5年）。
sen.e: Therefore, it was general for tofu makers to use the aforementioned antifoaming agent from a long time ago ("Tofu Shusetsu" (Compilation of Tofu Making Theory) in 1872).

sen.j: また消泡剤には乳化剤としての側面も持っていて、呉液を乳化させることにより大豆中の旨み成分（大豆油のアミノ酸等）を豆乳の中に引き出す重要な役割も担っている。
sen.e: The antifoaming agent also has an aspect of emulsifying agent, and plays an important role of drawing tasty ingredients (amino acid in soybean oil, and other ingredients) contained in soybeans by emulsifying fluid Go.

sen.e: As a result, the special sale becomes usual because supermarkets and convenience-store operators have a strong power to decide a price, and a price in the special sale becomes a recommended retail price, which cause a squeeze on management.

sen.e: Moreover, although most of soybeans as raw materials are imported from the United States of America, the production volume of non-genetically-engineered soybeans which are used as raw materials is less than 10% of total production volume in the United States of America, and a price of those soybeans is approx. three times a price of genetically-engineered soybeans.

sen.j: また、米国のエネルギー安全保障政策でバイオ燃料作物への転作が進み急激な高騰や、包装等の資材の原油価格高騰による原材料費高騰も経営を圧迫している。
sen.e: In addition, a squeeze on management is caused by steep price escalation due to enhancement of shift to crops for biofuel under the U.S. Energy Security Policy, and by escalating price of raw materials due to escalating price of oil as materials such as packaging materials, etc.

Additionally, a squeeze on management is caused by steep price escalation due to the accelerated shift toward the use of crops for bio-fuel under the U.S. Energy Security Policy, and by raising the price of raw materials due to the escalating price of oil as an ingredient in packaging materials, etc.

sen.j: また、製造工程からででくるおからは法的には産業廃棄物扱いであり、不法投棄や処分費問題をかかえている。
sen.e: Makers have problems of illegal dumping or cost of disposal because okara yielded in the manufacturing process is treated as industrial waste by law.
Makers face the challenge of illegal dumping or the disposal expense, because by law the okara yielded in the manufacturing process is treated as industrial waste.

tit.e: Momendofu which is also eaten by animals
